intro: Brachyscome iberidifolia var. diffusa, commonly known as the spreading bluebell, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It features small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, with a distinctive central yellow disk. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant collections.
